title: Football Players Impress at Alabama's 2025 Pro Day
text:
Football Players Impress at Alabama’s 2025 Pro Day
3/19/2025 5:05:00 PM | Football
The Crimson Tide welcomed all 32 NFL organizations to campus Wednesday
TUSCALOOSA, Ala. – The University of Alabama football program hosted its annual Pro Day inside the Hank Crisp Indoor Facility Wednesday, with 11 draft-eligible Crimson Tide athletes meeting with and showcasing their talents in front of representatives from all 32 NFL teams, including numerous head coaches and general managers.
The draft-eligible players that participated in the event included Tyler Booker, James Burnip, Jihaad Campbell, CJ Dippre, Kneeland Hibbett, Jalen Milroe, Malachi Moore, Graham Nicholson, Robbie Ouzts, Que Robinson and Tim Smith.
Today's event began at 10 a.m. CT with the athletes testing bench press and vertical jump in the Bill Battle Athletic Performance Center. They then tested in the broad jump, 40-yard dash, agility drills and position-specific drills in the Hank Crisp Indoor Facility. The SEC Network broadcast the Crimson Tide's events.
The 2025 NFL Draft is scheduled for April 24-26 in Green Bay, Wisc. Full coverage will air on NFL Network, ABC and ESPN.
